titleStmt.title: John G. Foster, Special Orders, No. 35
CWG11561

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

body.p:
Headquarters Department of the Ohio,
Knoxville, Tenn., Feby 4th 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS, No. 35.
11 ,, The resignation of 1st Lt. Buford Scott. 1st Ky. Cavy Volunteers, tendered on account of ^for the^ "good of the Service" is hereby accepted to take effect February 5h 1864
Any balance of pay due him at that time, will be suspended until satisfactory evidence is furnished to the Paymaster, that he is not indebted to the United States Government.

BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL FOSTER:
Henry Curtis Jr.
Assistant Adjutant General.

His Excellency
Govr. Thos. Bramlette
Ky

1 Cavy
Scott B. 1st Lieut
Resignation (good of the service)
Recd at A. G. O. Feby 11. 1864
